definition[0]: if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out
example[0]: The eggs take three days to hatch.
definition[1]: if a young bird, insect etc hatches, or if it is hatched, it comes out of its egg
example[1]: All the chicks have hatched out.
definition[2]: a hole in a ship or aircraft, usually used for loading goods, or the door that covers it
note[0]: escape hatch (=a hole in an aircraft etc through which you can escape)
definition[3]: a small hole in the wall, floor, or ceiling of a room, or the door that covers it
